bib_record.title: Measurement of the prompt neutron number distribution probability of U235 fission induced by thermal neutron

free_txt: Heavy water reactor
Hughes,J,NUC,17,11,1959
2 groups of BF3 were used. One group was 12 CHM-
8 (B-10 concentration of 80%, 35 mm in diameter, 1000
mm long, inflation pressure of 400 millimeters of
mercury, working voltage 2400 V, flat width 300 V).
The other was 19 CHM-7 (B-10 concentration of 90%, 35
mm in diameter, 550 mm long, inflation pressure of
400 millimeters of mercury, working voltage 2600 V,
flat width 100 V). Total content of boron was 4.33
grams.
The fission ionization chamber was entirely
made of Al, with a diameter of 60mm and a length of
150mm. The thickness of the front and back walls was
less than 1mm. The ionization chamber was filled with
Ar gas with a height of 600 mm of mercury, and the
working voltage was negative 200 V.
The first source of uncertainty was from
statistics, especially the statistical uncertainties
of 5, 4 and 3 neutrons emission probability. The
second source of uncertainty was from detector
efficiency. The uncertainties from instrument
instability and electronic gate width instability
were ignored for far less than statistical uncertainty.
Heavy water reactor
The reactor power was 100 kW and the neutron
flux was about 5E3 n/s/cm2.
Neutrons were moderated by heavy water and measured
by the BF3 detector.The container for heavy water was
a large cylinder made of Al, with an outer diameter
of 800 mm, a length of 700 mm, and a wall thickness
of 5 mm. The center of the cylinder was a cylindrical
cavity for placing a fission ionization chamber, with
an inner diameter of 65 mm. Around the cavity, 40 Al
tubes with a diameter of 37 mm were symmetrically
arranged (divided into three circles, each with 8, 12,
and 20 tubes), and BF3 were placed inside. A graphite
reflector with a thickness of 500 mm was stacked
around the system. At the end of the horizontal
transport channel, a graphite pillar(phi 145 * 600
mm) was place to the active zone. The cadmium ratio
of the neutron beam increased from 10 to 56. The
collimator placed in the horizontal channel is made
of boron containing paraffin, with a central aperture
of 6.5 mm, an outer diameter of 200 mm, and a length
of 1200 mm. The lead protective layer(600*600*600
mm3) was at the orifice, with a central square hole
size of 20*20 mm2. Paraffin layer containing B (100mm
thick) and Cd sheet are used to shield the entire
system. The system efficiency was 14.72 %. The
measurement time was about 50 hours.
20% enriched uranium is plated on both sides of the
aluminum foil using a neutral alcohol solution
electroplating method, with a thickness of 0.5
mg/cm2. There were 14 sheets in total.
